data.title: Resume
data.meta_description: Congressman Brad Sherman Public Sector 1991 - Present
data.text:
Congressman Brad Sherman

Public Sector 1991 - Present

Member of the U.S. House of Representatives, 1997 - Present

Financial Services Committee, 1997 - Present

Chair, Subcommittee on Investor Protection, Entrepreneurship, and Capital Markets

Subcommittee on Housing, Community Development, and Insurance

Subcommittee on Consumer Protection and Financial Institutions

Foreign Affairs Committee, 1997 - Present

Subcommittee on Asia, the Pacific, Central Asia, and Nonproliferation (Chairman during the 116th Congress)

Subcommittee on Middle East, North Africa, and Global Counterterrorism

Subcommittee on International Development, International Organizations, and Global Corporate Social Impact

Committee on Science, Space, and Technology (1998 - 1999; 2003 - 2007; 2019 - Present)

Subcommittee on Space and Aeronautics

Co-Chair, CPA and Accountants Caucus, 2013 - Present

Co-Chair, India Caucus

Armenian Caucus

Chairman, California State Board of Equalization, California's elected tax commission and America's second largest tax agency, 1991 - 1995

Instructor, Harvard Law School International Tax Program. Participated as a staff member of a big-four CPA firm in the financial audits of large businesses and government entities; provided tax law counsel on major transactions; provided tax and investment advice to entrepreneurs and small businesses. Helped represent the Government of Philippines under President Aquino in a successful effort to seize assets of deposed President Marcos. Member of the Board of California Common Cause, 1985-1989.

Education

Harvard Law School, J.D., Magna Cum Laude; UCLA, B.A., Summa Cum Laude

Licenses

Certified Public Accountant (CPA), California [Inactive]. Attorney, California State Bar. Certified by California State Bar as a Tax Law Specialist.
